alert.note: Alert for Southern Cook, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 21 at 3:22AM CDT until April 21 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy wet snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow showers expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Southern Cook County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Grand Portage Reservation. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM CDT early this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Steady snow this morning will transition to snow showers this afternoon. Expect rapidly changing visibilities over short distances.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
